section.title: Operation 66: SEEK
section.t: SEEK is an operation that allows a client to determine the location of the next data_content4 in a file. It allows an implementation of the emerging extension to lseek(2) to allow clients to determine the next hole whilst in data or the next data whilst in a hole.

section.title: DESCRIPTION
section.t: From the given sa_offset, find the next data_content4 of type sa_what in the file. For a hole, this must return the data_content4 in its entirety. For data, it must not return the actual data.
SEEK must follow the same rules for stateids as READ_PLUS ().
If the server could not find a corresponding sa_what, then the status would still be NFS4_OK, but sr_eof would be TRUE. The sr_contents would contain a zero-ed out content of the appropriate type.
